text: Live Nation is unique and that we touch
500 million fans globally in 40
countries every year in our work to get
closer to the fan a lot of that work
means data and more data how do we know
what the fan wants what concerts they've
been to what food and beverage they like
all of that data requires computers and
storage and so as our data grows we need
the ability to grow our infrastructure
with it why are we spending our time
running data centers why are we spending
our time monitoring disk utilization
looking at network switches routers and
firewalls and paying for air
conditioning and all the elements that
go into running a data center those are
not strategic to us as a company they do
not serve our fan base and they do not
serve the artists and they do not serve
our employees AWS gives us an
opportunity to experiment that we didn't
have in a traditional data center to
bring up an environment and maybe try
out new software try out new techniques
and technologies that we couldn't do
before the number one positive impact in
moving to AWS has been agility we have
the ability to spin up an environment to
do a proof of concept or to do a side
project a small project rapidly turn
that around and then shut the
environment down we could not do that in
the data set in AWS when you size your
ec2 instances there's a lot of
forgiveness there when you go to run
your application if it doesn't perform
well you shut it down
you select a new ec2 instance size and
you bring it back up and you haven't
spent any additional money there is no
capex expenditure associated with that
AWS is going to spend more on security
than we can ever afford to spend so we
are actually moving to a more secure
environment we're currently using Oracle
financials and we needed to determine
Oracle run in the cloud will it run an
AWS and so the very first thing that we
did instead of going down a lot of
different paths we jumped into a proof
of concept what we found is compared to
the system running in our data center we
saw results of 200% improvement when
looking at number of concurrent
connections to our financials from a
performance standpoint we had two
specific processes that we're taking
three and a half hours each and those
are now running in ten minutes
choosing one cloud provider allowed us
to become experts in that cloud and to
do all of this work ourselves we've
rebranded our infrastructure team as
cloud services we trained all of the
members of that team and they all became
AWS certified and that allowed us to do
this in 15 months using internal
resources
